item.title: Global Fund AlphaBit Backs Singapore Blockchain Startup BitCar - Coinjournal
item.description:
BitCar, a Singapore-based blockchain startup, has announced that AlphaBit, a fund launched last year, has purchased a “substantial number of BitCar tokens.” BitCar is currently conducting a token sale to fund the development of its blockchain platform, which intends to facilitate the pegging of cryptocurrency to scarce hard assets such as rare and exotic cards. […]

This post Global Fund AlphaBit Backs Singapore Blockchain Startup BitCar first appeared on Coinjournal.
item.dc:creator: Coinjournal

item.title: Canadian Blockchain Startup Expands Into Crypto-Friendly Wyoming - CryptoCoins News
item.description:
The post Canadian Blockchain Startup Expands Into Crypto-Friendly Wyoming appeared first on CCN

Nova Scotia-based BlockCrushr is expanding into the lower 48. The blockchain startup has chosen Wyoming for its new corporate subsidiary amid the state’s openness to both the technology and cryptocurrencies, as evidenced by pending legislation. BlockCrushr Wyoming’s presence ahead of the state Legislature’s ruling suggests the startup is confident about the prospects of the policy.

The post Canadian Blockchain Startup Expands Into Crypto-Friendly Wyoming appeared first on CCN
item.dc:creator: CryptoCoins News

item.title: Singapore Central Bank: Speculators Pose Risks To ‘Fabulous’ 2020 Blockchain Goals - Cointelegraph
item.description: Singapore’s central bank has warned Blockchain’s “real impact” could hit slower due to speculators. #NEWS

item.title: New Technology Records Global Marriages on Blockchain - News BTC
item.description:
Distributed ledgers can be used to record different kinds of data. While most efforts focus on the financial sector right now, there are plenty of other use cases for blockchain as well. Recording marriages on a distributed ledger is an option well worth exploring as of right now. Especially given the current marriage laws in … Continue reading New Technology Records Global Marriages on Blockchain

The post New Technology Records Global Marriages on Blockchain appeared first on NewsBTC.
item.dc:creator: News BTC

item.title: Islamic Endowments to be Modernized by Blockchain - News BTC
item.description:
The potential applications for blockchain technology are seemingly endless. Every day a new startup applies distributed ledger technology and smart contracts that underlie cryptocurrencies to a different world scenario offering new and innovative ways to streamline existing systems. Islamic charitable endowments, called waqf, are the latest to get the blockchain treatment. According to reports Singapore … Continue reading Islamic Endowments to be Modernized by Blockchain

The post Islamic Endowments to be Modernized by Blockchain appeared first on NewsBTC.
item.dc:creator: News BTC

item.title: T-Mobile's Blockchain Work Is Quietly Coming Together - CoinDesk
item.description: T-Mobile has entered the blockchain space and it's using Hyperledger technology as a way to rebuild its services on open-source software.

item.description:
The first law of Thermodynamics states “Energy is neither created nor destroyed. It simply transforms itself from one form to another.” No where is this law better applied than in the case of 4NEW, the world’s first waste to energy power plant entirely integrated on the blockchain. When interviewing for this story with the founder, … Continue reading 4NEW: BLOCKCHAIN POWERED BY FREE ENERGY

item.title: How will Blockchain Technology Affect the Art World - News BTC
item.description:
Innovations in technology have always resulted in changes in the way art is created and presented. Woven canvas resulted in mobile paintings, photography allowed for abstract compositions, electric light brought new ideas in color theory and now Blockchain technology is inspiring digital works. Art and technological innovation are inseparable As industry begins to implement Blockchain ledger … Continue reading How will Blockchain Technology Affect the Art World

The post How will Blockchain Technology Affect the Art World appeared first on NewsBTC.

item.title: Ripple (XRP), Cardano (ADA), and EOS Make Gains Today - Cryptocurrency News
item.description:
Ripple (XRP), Cardano (ADA), and EOS all started the day with gains and are currently the leading coins. 

Are the markets on the road to recovery? It’s hard to think otherwise when there’s nothing but green on the boards right now. Everything’s up at the moment, including Ripple, Cardano, and EOS. How long will the gains last?

>> Check out the Crypto Olympics!

Ripple (XRP)

Still ranked as the third largest cryptocurrency, Ripple is currently selling for $0.930491. In the past 24 hours, the altcoin has risen by 23.16%. Ripple is currently ...

item.title: Everipedia Secures US$30M Investment For P2P Encyclopedia On The Blockchain - Coinjournal
item.description:
Everipedia, a wiki-based, online encyclopedia, has secured a US$30 million investment from a group of strategic investors led by Galaxy Digital’s EOS.IO Ecosystem Fund with participation from the Distributed Network Advisors (DNA) Fund and others. The startup said the funding will be used to launch Everipedia’s open source blockchain network, and grow its community on […]

This post Everipedia Secures US$30M Investment For P2P Encyclopedia On The Blockchain first appeared on Coinjournal.
item.dc:creator: Coinjournal

item.title: Blockchain Payments Platform BitPesa Acquires TransferZero - Coinjournal
item.description:
Online blockchain payment platform BitPesa is expanding its reach after announcing the acquisition of TransferZero, an international money transfer platform. Founded in 2013, BitPesa has become one of the largest blockchain payment platforms for Africa and Europe and has seen a 24 percent month-over-month growth for the last two years, according to Elizabeth Rossiello, founder […]

This post Blockchain Payments Platform BitPesa Acquires TransferZero first appeared on Coinjournal.
item.dc:creator: Coinjournal

item.title: Japan Net Bank And Fujitsu Trial Blockchain With Mijin And Hyperledger - Coinjournal
item.description:
Japanese blockchain startup Tech Bureau has announced that Japan Net Bank and Fujitsu are testing blockchain technology integrations using Mijin, Tech Bureau’s private blockchain platform utilizing the NEM protocol, and the Hyperledger platform. The proof-of-concept project will focus on assessing the practicality of using blockchain technology for a paperless system for contract administration. It is […]

This post Japan Net Bank And Fujitsu Trial Blockchain With Mijin And Hyperledger first appeared on Coinjournal.
item.dc:creator: Coinjournal
